usx.para: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Therefore, my beloved brothers whom I long for, my joy and crown, in this way stand firm in the Lord, beloved friends.

Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the ones set apart in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Finally, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. For me to write these same things to you is not a problem, and they will keep you safe. Watch out for the dogs. Watch out for the evil workers. Watch out for the mutilators.

If there is therefore any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from his love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassions, make my joy full so that you are of the same mind, have the same love, are united in spirit, and have the same purpose.
